register.name: CANCTL0
register.description: Control Register 0

field.name: INITRQ
field.description:
Initialization Mode Request
 When this bit is set by the CPU, the MSCAN skips to initialization mode.
 Any ongoing transmission or reception is aborted and synchronization to the CAN bus is lost.
 The module indicates entry to initialization mode by setting INITAK = 1

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Running - The MSCAN operates normally

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Sleep mode request - The MSCAN enters sleep mode when CAN bus idle

field.name: SLPRQ
field.description: Sleep Mode Request\n This bit requests the MSCAN to enter sleep mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Running - The MSCAN operates normally

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Sleep mode request - The MSCAN enters sleep mode when CAN bus idle

field.name: WUPE
field.description: WakeUp Enable\n This configuration bit allows the MSCAN to restart from sleep mode or from power down mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Wakeup disabled - The MSCAN ignores traffic on CAN

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Wakeup enabled - The MSCAN is able to restart

field.name: TIME
field.description: Timer Enable\n This bit activates an internal 16-bit wide free running timer which is clocked by the bit clock rate

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Disable internal MSCAN timer

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Enable internal MSCAN timer

field.name: SYNCH
field.description: Synchronized Status\n This read-only flag indicates whether the MSCAN is synchronized to the CAN bus

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: MSCAN is not synchronized to the CAN bus

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: MSCAN is synchronized to the CAN bus

field.name: CSWAI
field.description: CAN Stops in Wait Mode\n Enabling this bit allows for lower power consumption in wait mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: The module is not affected during wait mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The module ceases to be clocked during wait mode

field.name: RXACT
field.description: Receiver Active Status\n This read-only flag indicates the MSCAN is receiving a message

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: MSCAN is transmitting or idle

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: MSCAN is receiving a message, including when arbitration is lost

field.name: RXFRM
field.description: Received Frame Flag\n This bit is read and clear only.\n It is set when a receiver has received a valid message correctly,

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No valid message was received since last clearing this flag

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: A valid message was received since last clearing of this flag

register.name: CANCTL1
register.description: Control Register 1

field.name: INITAK
field.description:
Initialization Mode Acknowledge
 This flag indicates whether the MSCAN module is in initialization mode.
 It is used as a handshake flag for the INITRQ initialization mode request.
 Initialization mode is active when INITRQ = 1 and INITAK = 1.
 The registers CANCTL1, CANBTR0, CANBTR1, CANIDAC, CANIDAR0-CANIDAR7, and CANIDMR0-CANIDMR7 can be written only by the CPU when the MSCAN is in initialization mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Running - The MSCAN operates normally

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Initialization mode active - The MSCAN has entered initialization mode

field.name: SLPAK
field.description: Sleep Mode Acknowledge\n This flag indicates whether the MSCAN module has entered sleep mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Running - The MSCAN operates normally

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Sleep mode active - The MSCAN has entered sleep

field.name: WUPM
field.description: WakeUp Mode\n If WUPE in CANCTL0 is enabled, this bit defines whether the integrated low-pass filter is applied to protect the MSCAN from spurious wakeup

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: MSCAN wakes on any dominant level on the CAN bus

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: MSCAN wakes only in case of a dominant pulse on the CAN bus that has a length of Twup

field.name: BORM
field.description: Bus-Off Recovery Mode\n This bit configures the bus-off state recovery mode of the MSCAN

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Automatic bus-off recovery (see Bosch CAN 2.0A/B protocol specification)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Bus-off recovery upon user request

field.name: LISTEN
field.description: Listen Only Mode\n This bit configures the MSCAN as a CAN bus monitor

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Normal operation

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Listen only mode activated

field.name: LOOPB
field.description: Loopback Self Test Mode\n When this bit is set, the MSCAN performs an internal loopback

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Loopback self test disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Loopback self test enabled

field.name: CLKSRC
field.description: MSCAN Clock Source\n This bit defines the clock source for the MSCAN module

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: MSCAN clock source is the oscillator clock

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: MSCAN clock source is the bus clock

field.name: CANE
field.description: MSCAN Enable

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: MSCAN module is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: MSCAN module is enabled

register.name: CANBTR0
register.description: Bus Timing Register 0\n This register configures various CAN bus timing parameters

field.name: BRP
field.description: Baud Rate Prescaler\n These bits determine the time quanta (Tq) clock which is used to build up the bit timing.\n Prescale = N+1

field.name: SJW
field.description: Synchronization Jump Width The synchronization jump width defines the maximum number of time quanta (Tq) clock cycles a bit can be shortened or lengthened to achieve resynchronization to data transitions on the CAN bus\n Width = N+1

register.name: CANBTR1
register.description: Bus Timing Register 1\n This register configures various CAN bus timing parameters of the MSCAN module

field.name: TSEG1
field.description:
Time Segment 1
 Time segments within the bit time fix the number of clock cycles per bit time and the location of the sample point.
 Time = N+1
 The bit time is determined by the oscillator frequency, the baud rate prescaler, and the number of time quanta (Tq) clock cycles per bit.
 Bit time = (1 + timesegment1 + timesegment2) * (Prescaler value)/ fCANCLK

field.name: TSEG2
field.description: Time Segment 2\n Time segments within the bit time fix the number of clock cycles per bit time and the location of the sample point.\n Time = N+1

field.name: SAMP
field.description: Sampling\n This bit determines the number of CAN bus samples taken per bit time

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: One sample per bit

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Three samples per bit. In this case, PHASE_SEG1 must be at least 2 time quanta (Tq)

register.name: CANRFLG
register.description: Receiver Flag Register

field.name: RXF
field.description: Receive Buffer Full Flag\n RXF is set by the MSCAN when a new message is shifted in the receiver FIFO

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No new message available within the RxFG

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The receiver FIFO is not empty. A new message is available in the RxFG

field.name: OVRIF
field.description: Overrun Interrupt Flag\n This flag is set when a data overrun condition occurs. If not masked, an error interrupt is pending while this flag is set

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No data overrun condition

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: A data overrun detected

field.name: TSTAT
field.description: Transmitter Status\n The values of the error counters control the actual CAN bus status of the MSCAN

enumeratedValue.name: 0b00
enumeratedValue.description: TxOK: 0<=transmit error counter<96

enumeratedValue.name: 0b01
enumeratedValue.description: TxWRN: 96<=transmit error counter<128

enumeratedValue.name: 0b10
enumeratedValue.description: TxERR: 128<=transmit error counter<256

enumeratedValue.name: 0b11
enumeratedValue.description: Bus-off: 256<=transmit error counter

field.name: RSTAT
field.description: Receiver Status\n The values of the error counters control the actual CAN bus status of the MSCAN

enumeratedValue.name: 0b00
enumeratedValue.description: RxOK: 0<=receive error counter<96

enumeratedValue.name: 0b01
enumeratedValue.description: RxWRN: 96<=receive error counter<128

enumeratedValue.name: 0b10
enumeratedValue.description: RxERR: 128<=receive error counter

enumeratedValue.name: 0b11
enumeratedValue.description: Bus-off: 256<=transmit error counter\n (Redundant Information for the critical CAN bus-off status)

field.name: CSCIF
field.description: CAN Status Change Interrupt Flag\n This flag is set when the MSCAN changes its current CAN bus status due to the actual value of the transmit error counter (TEC) and the receive error counter (REC)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No change in CAN bus status occurred since last interrupt

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: MSCAN changed current CAN bus status

field.name: WUPIF
field.description: Wake-Up Interrupt Flag\n If the MSCAN detects CAN bus activity while in sleep mode and CANTCTL0[WUPE] = 1, the module will set WUPIF. If not masked, a wake-up interrupt is pending while this flag is set

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No wakeup activity observed while in sleep mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: MSCAN detected activity on the CAN bus and requested wakeup

register.name: CANRIER
register.description: Receiver Interrupt Enable Register\n This register contains the interrupt enable bits for the interrupt flags described in the CANRFLG register

field.name: RXFIE
field.description: Receiver Full Interrupt Enable

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt request is generated from this event

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: A receive buffer full (successful message reception) event causes a receiver interrupt request

field.name: OVRIE
field.description: Overrun Interrupt Enable

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt request is generated from this event

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: An overrun event causes an error interrupt request

field.name: TSTATE
field.description: Transmitter Status Change Enable\n These TSTAT enable bits control the sensitivity level in which transmitter state changes are causing CSCIF interrupts

enumeratedValue.name: 0b00
enumeratedValue.description: Do not generate any CSCIF interrupt caused by transmitter state changes

enumeratedValue.name: 0b01
enumeratedValue.description: Generate CSCIF interrupt only if the transmitter enters or leaves "bus-off" state. Discard other transmitter state changes for generating CSCIF interrupt

enumeratedValue.name: 0b10
enumeratedValue.description: Generate CSCIF interrupt only if the transmitter enters or leaves "TxErr" or "bus-off" state. Discard other transmitter state changes for generating CSCIF interrupt

enumeratedValue.name: 0b11
enumeratedValue.description: Generate CSCIF interrupt on all state changes

field.name: RSTATE
field.description: Receiver Status Change Enable\n These RSTAT enable bits control the sensitivity level in which receiver state changes are causing CSCIF interrupts

enumeratedValue.name: 0b00
enumeratedValue.description: Do not generate any CSCIF interrupt caused by receiver state changes

enumeratedValue.name: 0b01
enumeratedValue.description: Generate CSCIF interrupt only if the receiver enters or leaves "bus-off" state. Discard other receiver state changes for generating CSCIF interrupt

enumeratedValue.name: 0b10
enumeratedValue.description: Generate CSCIF interrupt only if the receiver enters or leaves "RxErr" or "bus-off"1 state. Discard other receiver state changes for generating CSCIF interrupt

enumeratedValue.name: 0b11
enumeratedValue.description: Generate CSCIF interrupt on all state changes

field.name: CSCIE
field.description: CAN Status Change Interrupt Enable

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt request is generated from this event

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: A CAN Status Change event causes an error interrupt request

field.name: WUPIE
field.description: WakeUp Interrupt Enable\n WUPIE and WUPE must both be enabled if the recovery mechanism from stop or wait is required

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt request is generated from this event

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: A wake-up event causes a Wake-Up interrupt request

register.name: CANTFLG
register.description: Transmitter Flag Register

field.name: TXE
field.description: Transmitter Buffer Empty\n These flags indicates that the associated transmit message buffer is empty, and thus not scheduled for transmission

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: The associated message buffer is full (loaded with a message due for transmission)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The associated message buffer is empty (not scheduled)

register.name: CANTIER
register.description: Transmitter Interrupt Enable Register\n This register contains the interrupt enable bits for the transmit buffer empty interrupt flags

field.name: TXEIE
field.description: Transmitter Empty Interrupt Enable

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt request is generated from this event

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: A transmitter empty (transmit buffer available for transmission) event causes a transmitter empty interrupt request

register.name: CANTARQ
register.description: Transmitter Message Abort Request Register\n The CANTARQ register allows abort request of queued messages

field.name: ABTRQ
field.description: Abort Request\n The CPU sets the ABTRQx bit to request that a scheduled message buffer (TXEx = 0) be aborted

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No abort request

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Abort request pending

register.name: CANTAAK
register.description: Transmitter Message Abort Acknowledge Register\n The CANTAAK register indicates the successful abort of a queued message, if requested by the appropriate bits in the CANTARQ register

field.name: ABTAK
field.description: Abort Acknowledge\n This flag acknowledges that a message was aborted due to a pending abort request from the CPU

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: The message was not aborted

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The message was aborted

register.name: CANTBSEL
register.description: Transmit Buffer Selection Register\n The CANTBSEL register allows the selection of the actual transmit message buffer, which then will be accessible in the CANTXFG register space

field.name: TX
field.description: Transmit Buffer Select\n The lowest numbered bit places the respective transmit buffer in the CANTXFG register space (e.g., TX1 = 1 and TX0 = 1 selects transmit buffer TX0; TX1 = 1 and TX0 = 0 selects transmit buffer TX1)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: The associated message buffer is deselected

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The associated message buffer is selected, if lowest numbered bit

register.name: CANIDAC
register.description: Identifier Acceptance Control Register\n The CANIDAC register is used for identifier acceptance control

field.name: IDHIT
field.description:
Identifier Acceptance Hit Indicator
 The MSCAN sets these flags to indicate an identifier acceptance hit.
 The IDHIT indicators are always related to the message in the foreground buffer (RxFG).
 When a message gets shifted into the foreground buffer of the receiver FIFO the indicators are updated as well

field.name: IDAM
field.description: Identifier Acceptance Mode\n The CPU sets these flags to define the identifier acceptance filter organization. In filter closed mode, no message is accepted such that the foreground buffer is never reloaded

enumeratedValue.name: 0b00
enumeratedValue.description: Two 32-bit acceptance filters

enumeratedValue.name: 0b01
enumeratedValue.description: Four 16-bit acceptance filters

enumeratedValue.name: 0b10
enumeratedValue.description: Eight 8-bit acceptance filters

enumeratedValue.name: 0b11
enumeratedValue.description: Filter closed

register.name: CANMISC
register.description: Miscellaneous Register

field.name: BOHOLD
field.description: Bus-off State Hold Until User Request\n If BORM is set in MSCAN Control Register 1 (CANCTL1), this bit indicates whether the module has entered the bus-off state. Clearing this bit requests the recovery from bus-off

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Module is not bus-off or recovery has been requested by user in bus-off state

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Module is bus-off and holds this state until user request

register.name: CANRXERR
register.description: Receive Error Counter\n This register reflects the status of the MSCAN receive error counter

register.name: CANTXERR
register.description: Transmit Error Counter\n This register reflects the status of the MSCAN transmit error counter

register.name: CANIDAR%s
register.description:
Identifier Acceptance Register n of First Bank
 On reception, each message is written into the background receive buffer.
 The CPU is only signalled to read the message if it passes the criteria in the identifier acceptance and identifier mask registers (accepted); otherwise, the message is overwritten by the next message (dropped).
 The acceptance registers of the MSCAN are applied on the REIDR0-REIDR3 registers for the extendard identifiers and RSIDR0-RSIDR1 registers for the standard identifiers of incoming messages in a bit by bit manner

register.name: CANIDMR%s
register.description: Identifier Mask Register n of First Bank\n The identifier mask register specifies which of the corresponding bits in the identifier acceptance register are relevant for acceptance filtering. To receive standard identifiers in 32-bit filter mode, it is required to program the last three bits (AM[2:0]) in the mask registers CANIDMR1 and CANIDMR5 to "don't care." To receive standard identifiers in 16 bit filter mode, it is required to program the last three bits (AM[2:0]) in the mask registers CANIDMR1, CANIDMR3, CANIDMR5, and CANIDMR7 to "don't care."

register.name: CANIDAR%s
register.description:
Identifier Acceptance Register n of Second Bank
 On reception, each message is written into the background receive buffer.
 The CPU is only signalled to read the message if it passes the criteria in the identifier acceptance and identifier mask registers (accepted); otherwise, the message is overwritten by the next message (dropped).
 The acceptance registers of the MSCAN are applied on the REIDR0-REIDR3 registers for the extendard identifiers and RSIDR0-RSIDR1 registers for the standard identifiers of incoming messages in a bit by bit manner

register.name: CANIDMR%s
register.description: Identifier Mask Register n of Second Bank\n The identifier mask register specifies which of the corresponding bits in the identifier acceptance register are relevant for acceptance filtering. To receive standard identifiers in 32-bit filter mode, it is required to program the last three bits (AM[2:0]) in the mask registers CANIDMR1 and CANIDMR5 to "don't care." To receive standard identifiers in 16 bit filter mode, it is required to program the last three bits (AM[2:0]) in the mask registers CANIDMR1, CANIDMR3, CANIDMR5, and CANIDMR7 to "don't care."

register.name: REIDR%s
register.description: Receive Extended Identifier Register %n\n The identifier registers for an extended format identifier consist of a total of 32 bits: REID[28:0], RSRR, REIDE, and RRTR

register.name: RSIDR%s
register.description: Receive Standard Identifier Register %n\n The identifier registers for a standard format identifier consist of a total of 13 bits: RSID[10:0], RRTR, and REIDE

register.name: REDSR%s
register.description: Receive Extended Data Segment Register %n\n The eight data segment registers, each with bits RDB[7:0], contain the data to be received. The number of bytes to be received is determined by the data length code in the corresponding RDLR register

register.name: RDLR
register.description: Receive Data Length Register\n This register keeps the data length field of the CAN frame

field.name: RDLC
field.description: Data Length Code Bits\n The data length code contains the number of bytes (data byte count) of the respective message. During the transmission of a remote frame, the data length code is transmitted as programmed while the number of transmitted data bytes is always 0. The data byte count ranges from 0 to 8 for a data frame

register.name: RTSRH
register.description: Receive Time Stamp Register High\n If the TIME bit is enabled, the MSCAN will write a time stamp to the respective registers in the active receive buffer right after the EOF of a valid message on the CAN bus

register.name: RTSRL
register.description: Receive Time Stamp Register Low\n If the TIME bit is enabled, the MSCAN will write a time stamp to the respective registers in the active receive buffer right after the EOF of a valid message on the CAN bus

register.name: TEIDR%s
register.description: Transmit Extended Identifier Register %n\n The identifier registers for an extended format identifier consist of a total of 32 bits: TEID[28:0], TSRR, TIDE, and TRTR

register.name: TSIDR%s
register.description: Transmit Standard Identifier Register %n\n The identifier registers for a standard format identifier consist of a total of 13 bits: TID[10:0], TRTR, and TSIDE

register.name: TEDSR%s
register.description: Transmit Extended Data Segment Register %n\n The eight data segment registers, each with bits TDB[7:0], contain the data to be transmitted. The number of bytes to be transmitted is determined by the data length code in the corresponding TDLR register

register.name: TDLR
register.description: Transmit Data Length Register\n This register keeps the data length field of the CAN frame

register.name: TBPR
register.description: Transmit Buffer Priority Register\n This register defines the local priority of the associated message buffer. The local priority is used for the internal prioritization process of the MSCAN and is defined to be highest for the smallest binary number

register.name: TTSRH
register.description: Transmit Time Stamp Register High\n If the TIME bit is enabled, the MSCAN will write a time stamp to the respective registers in the active transmit buffer right after the EOF of a valid message on the CAN bus. In case of a transmission, the CPU can only read the time stamp after the respective transmit buffer has been flagged empty

register.name: TTSRL
register.description: Transmit Time Stamp Register Low\n If the TIME bit is enabled, the MSCAN will write a time stamp to the respective registers in the active transmit buffer right after the EOF of a valid message on the CAN bus. In case of a transmission, the CPU can only read the time stamp after the respective transmit buffer has been flagged empty
